name: Herta
descHash: Member <nobr>83</nobr> of the Genius Society. The real master of the space station. An incredibly intelligent yet unsympathetic scientist.

29328.name: Credit
29328.desc: This currency, used by the Interastral Peace Corporation to settle accounts with its customers, is now widely accepted as the hard currency for space travel.
29328.lore: "People run around fighting and trading for numbers in a terminal, but the truly precious cannot be bought."

67219.name: Horn of Snow
67219.desc: Broken horn of a Frigid Prowler. Can be used for the Ascension of Ice characters.
67219.lore:
The Silvermane Guards would host contests where the winner must take a body part from a monster and bring it back within a set time limit. This cold broken horn must have been a trophy of one such contest.

"Sir Bova, this is no moose horn and is certainly not fit for decoration above the Geomarrow furnace."

125435.name: Tracks of Destiny
125435.lore: Your victory is secured by countless failures, and the small steps you have taken led you to the turning point of fate.

409960.name: Traveler's Guide
409960.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>20,000</nobr> Character EXP.
409960.lore:
Required reading for world exploration. Press the "Read" button to tune in to an attractive voice in a language you understand, telling you about the legendary encounters of renowned adventurers across different worlds as well as the precious wisdom and knowledge that they have gathered.

"All-new series of the Traveler's Guide, The Chef's Manual to Galactic Cuisine, is now available for purchase."
"For submissions, please connect to synesthesia beacon ERD-23θ to contact an Intelligentsia Guild representative. Method of payment can be arranged to your convenience."

409961.name: Adventure Log
409961.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>5000</nobr> Character EXP.
409961.lore:
A neatly organized collection of educational adventure notes containing countless illustrations and texts entailing adventures from beginning to end, as well as valuable information and survival-related techniques.

"Why not just digitize it and save it on a photolith disk? That'd be much more convenient."
"Advanced technology is far more fragile than you'd think when faced with stellar storms and neuron flow eruptions. Besides, I'm sure the author of this book wanted people to read it in the simplest of ways."

409962.name: Travel Encounters
409962.desc: Experience material for characters. Provides <nobr>1000</nobr> Character EXP.
409962.lore:
A travel diary with messy handwriting and random content. It's not of much use to you.

"Dan Heng, hurry up and finish reading it so you can throw it away."

549438.name: Extinguished Core
549438.desc: The heart of a monster wandering the Fragmentum. Crude material used for enhancement.
549438.lore:
It is a lesion that breeds evil, the impulse to sin. It is the source of the Fragmentum distortion.
A heavy blow has caused this heart to stop beating and lose its luster.

"Preliminary tests indicate it's some kind of hybrid: one half is primordial, and the other half is something very similar to Stellarons." — Department of Biology, Sarah Castro
comeFrom: Backwater Pass: Flamespawns or other enemies
Rivet Town: Flamespawns or other enemies

633379.name: Glimmering Core
633379.desc: The heart of a monster wandering the Fragmentum. Normal material used for enhancement.
633379.lore:
It is a lesion that breeds evil, the impulse to sin. It is the source of the Fragmentum distortion.
The heart is glimmering and the veins on it indicate it's still alive.

"What kind of monster is this? Did you see it... Its face! It has the face of our previous leader!"
comeFrom: Backwater Pass: Equilibrium Level 2+ Flamespawns or other enemies
Rivet Town: Equilibrium Level 2+ Flamespawns or other enemies

635675.name: Key of Inspiration
635675.desc: A mythical key that appears in the hands of the Meditative Scholars. Used to level up Traces slightly for Erudition characters.
635675.lore:
It can unlock inspirations hidden deep within the conscience.
To take hold of the key is to grasp at the darting embers of thought that lead to the forward path.

"Eureka!"

717320.name: Squirming Core
717320.desc: The heart of a monster wandering the Fragmentum. Advanced material used for enhancement.
717320.lore:
It is a lesion that breeds evil, the impulse to sin. It is the source of the Fragmentum distortion.
The heart is pulsating slowly, with a residual force powerful enough to cause a new calamity. It's best to destroy it to prevent further troubles.

"It's like a cancer..."
comeFrom: Backwater Pass: Equilibrium Level 4+ Flamespawns or other enemies
Rivet Town: Equilibrium Level 4+ Flamespawns or other enemies

836261.name: Key of Wisdom
836261.desc: A mythical key that appears in the hands of the greatest prodigies of the galaxy. Used to level up Traces significantly for Erudition characters.
836261.lore:
This is the proof of invitation to the halls of the Nous Temple.
Finding the door of which this key opens is a far more arduous task than obtaining the key itself. Those who pass through the doors will immediately realize the impossibility of returning to this side.

"The Erudition does not have answers to the universe, but it will teach you how to ask the right questions."

920202.name: Key of Knowledge
920202.desc: A mythical key that appears in the hands of the sages of the worlds. Used to level up Traces moderately for Erudition characters.
920202.lore:
It can unlock the mysteries binding the truth of the world and grants knowledge beyond the understanding of humans.
No matter how the wielder attempts to display their possession of the key, no one but themselves can see its form. Some people believe that to be a gift from the heavens, while others think it's a sign of mental disorder.

"I had a dream of molecules coiling up into a loop like a snake biting its own tail. I woke up realizing that this is the answer I've been looking for all along!"

985668.name: Destroyer's Final Road
985668.lore:
The Leviathan's heart has stopped beating, but its mind lives on despite being trapped in a case. As long as the lid is closed, its mind is simultaneously both alive and dead, driving the engine of destruction.

"Doomsday Beast, a blight made in the Warforge using what's left of a Leviathan and the weeping bones of thousands of the dead. It longs for the destruction of the universe and itself."

ranks.name: Kick You When You're Down
ranks.descHash: If the enemy's HP percentage is at <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> or less, Herta's Basic ATK deals Additional Ice DMG equal to <nobr>#2[i]%</nobr> of Herta's ATK.

ranks.name: Keep the Ball Rolling
ranks.descHash: Every time Talent is triggered, this character's CRIT Rate increases by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>. This effect can stack up to <nobr>#2[i]</nobr> time(s).

ranks.name: That's the Kind of Girl I Am
ranks.descHash:
Skill Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Basic ATK Lv. +1, up to a maximum of Lv. 10.

ranks.name: Hit Where It Hurts
ranks.descHash: When Talent is triggered, DMG increases by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>.

ranks.name: Cuss Big or Cuss Nothing
ranks.descHash:
Ultimate Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.
Talent Lv. +2, up to a maximum of Lv. 15.

ranks.name: No One Can Betray Me
ranks.descHash: After using Ultimate, this character's ATK increases by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> for <nobr>#2[i]</nobr> turn(s).

skills.name: What Are You Looking At?
skills.descHash: Deals Ice DMG equal to #1[i]% of Herta's ATK to a single enemy.

skills.name: One-Time Offer
skills.descHash: Deals Ice DMG equal to #1[i]% of Herta's ATK to all enemies. If the enemy's HP percentage is #2[i]% or higher, DMG dealt to this target increases by #3[i]%.

skills.name: It's Magic, I Added Some Magic
skills.descHash: Deals Ice DMG equal to #1[i]% of Herta's ATK to all enemies.

skills.name: Fine, I'll Do It Myself
skills.descHash: When an ally's attack causes an enemy's HP percentage to fall to #1[i]% or lower, Herta will launch a follow-up attack, dealing Ice DMG equal to #2[i]% of Herta's ATK to all enemies.

skills.name: Attack
skills.descHash: Attack an enemy, and when the battle starts, reduce their Toughness of the corresponding Type.

skills.name: It Can Still Be Optimized
skills.descHash: After using her Technique, Herta's ATK increases by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> for <nobr>#2[i]</nobr> turn(s) at the beginning of the next battle.

embedBonusSkill.name: Efficiency
embedBonusSkill.descHash: When Skill is used, the DMG Boost effect on target enemies increases by an extra <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>.

embedBonusSkill.name: Icing
embedBonusSkill.descHash: When Ultimate is used, deals <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr> more DMG to Frozen enemies.

embedBonusSkill.name: Puppet
embedBonusSkill.descHash: The chance to resist Crowd Control Debuffs increases by <nobr>#1[i]%</nobr>.

voiceItems.title: First Meeting
voiceItems.text: This is Herta. I'm busy right now. This is my ranged puppet's automated-response mode: Hello everyone. Hope you have a wonderful day. Goodbye.

voiceItems.title: Greeting
voiceItems.text: Why not come around today and help me with my research? You'll be the subject, by the way.

voiceItems.title: Parting
voiceItems.text: *sigh* I've lost interest in your research potential for today. See you tomorrow.

voiceItems.title: About Self: Puppet
voiceItems.text: What do you make of it? It's about seventy percent similar to how I looked as a child.

voiceItems.title: About Self: True Form
voiceItems.text: Best not to ponder, you'll be scratching your chin all day.

voiceItems.title: Chat: Genius Society
voiceItems.text: The good thing about this club is that it doesn't ask me for anything. In fact, it doesn't even care if I'm a member.

voiceItems.title: Chat: Visiting an Aeon
voiceItems.text: Why do I get to visit an Aeon? I'm Herta, that's why.

voiceItems.title: Hobbies
voiceItems.text: If you're not solving problems or writing up contributions, then don't blame me if your life is boring.

voiceItems.title: Annoyances
voiceItems.text: I'm perfect enough already. What else do I need to prove? Of course, I could write a few more books... but what would I get out of that? Why should I bother?

voiceItems.title: Something to Share
voiceItems.text: The Intelligentsia Guild is always able to find a way to support their case, writing enough "scholarship" in one night to fill a library... This is a problem.

voiceItems.title: Knowledge
voiceItems.text: The Lord of Silence erased the eyes from the portrait, but drew everyone's attention in the process.

voiceItems.title: About Arlan
voiceItems.text: Asta provided financial assistance to a few exceptional children — I assume Arlan was one of them.

voiceItems.title: About Asta
voiceItems.text: If my other collections had people like Asta watching over them, I could take a hands-off approach.

voiceItems.title: About Himeko
voiceItems.text: I give her the most boring things, and then she gives them back to me and they're suddenly interesting.

storyItems.title: Character Details
storyItems.text:
Herta space station's true master.
As the human with the highest IQ on the Blue, she only does what she's interested in, dropping projects the moment she loses interest — the best example being the space station.
She typically appears in the form of a remote-controlled puppet.
"It's about seventy percent similar to how I looked as a child." — Herta
